postData.title: Minimalist Linux Workspace
postData.markdownContentSource:
## Download Image

Download [Debian image](https://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/current/amd64/iso-cd/), let we choose the net-install ISO since we don't need any heavy desktop enviroment e.g. KDE, GNOME, etc... .

## Create Boot Device

There are a ton of tools which can burn ISO to a USB or CD, e.g. [Rufus](https://rufus.ie/), simply follow the instruction and create the boot device.

## Installation

Plug the USB into your computer reboot and following the instruction to complete the installation. Remember to use a different partition for **/home** which is helpful for reinstallation in the future.

## Update Sources List

* https://wiki.debian.org/SourcesList
* https://backports.debian.org/Instructions/

## Configure Openbox

    sudo apt install xinit openbox menu xfce4-terminal
    ehoc "exec openbox-session" >> ~/.xinitrc
    echo "startx" >> ~/.bash_profile

## Install Asian Fonts

    sudo apt install fonts-arphic-ukai fonts-arphic-uming fonts-ipafont-mincho fonts-ipafont-gothic fonts-unfonts-core
    sudo fc-cache -fv

## Enable Sound

    sudo install alsa-utils
    amixer set Master 100% unmute
